name: vscode-ceedling-test-adapter
description: Run your Ceedling tests in the Sidebar of Visual Studio Code

scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build

ceedlingExplorer.projectPath.description: Path to the Ceedling project directory

ceedlingExplorer.shellPath.description: Path to the shell where Ceedling is installed

ceedlingExplorer.debugConfiguration.description: Debug configuration to run during test debug.

ceedlingExplorer.prettyTestLabel.markdownDescription: Test label is prettier in the test explorer, that mean the label is shorter and without begin prefix. E.g. inactive `test_BlinkTaskShouldToggleLed`, active `BlinkTaskShouldToggleLed`

ceedlingExplorer.prettyTestFileLabel.markdownDescription: Test file label is prettier in the test explorer, that mean the label is shorter, without begin prefix, path and file type. E.g. inactive `test/LEDs/test_BlinkTask.c`, active `BlinkTask`

ceedlingExplorer.testCommandArgs.markdownDescription: The command line arguments used to run the Ceedling tests

ceedlingExplorer.problemMatching.markdownDescription: Configuration of mechanism that scans Ceedling output text for known error/warning/info strings and reports these inline in the editor and in the Problems panel. The mechanism tries to resemble the one used in VSCode Tasks problemMatchers.

mode.description: Mode of problem matching. It is either disabled, uses preset (i.e. gcc) or uses custom patterns from patterns array.

patterns.description: Array of custom pattern objects used for problem matching.

severity.description: Severity of messages found by this pattern.

filePrefix.markdownDescription: Used to determine file's absolute path if file location is relative. ${projectPath} replaced with project path. Not used if empty or not defined.

regexp.description: The regular expression that is used to find an error, warning or info in the output line.

message.description: Index of the problem's message in the regular expression.

file.description: Index of the problem's filename in the regular expression.

line.description: Index of the problem's (first) line in the regular expression. Not used if null or not defined.

lastLine.description: Index of the problem's last line in the regular expression. Not used if null or not defined.

column.description: Index of the problem's (first) column in the regular expression. Not used if null or not defined.

lastColumn.description: Index of the problem's last column in the regular expression. Not used if null or not defined.
